freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter

Utilities for writing pdf_filter functions.

This module provides decorators and utilities for filtering and processing PDF content based on XML elements, fonts, and positional data.

Functions

filter_page_if(condition)

Decorator factory for conditionally applying a PDF filter based on a predicate.

standard_extraction_subfund(subfund_height, ...)

Decorator for extracting subfund text and updating metadata.

standard_pdf_filtering(header_txt, ...[, ...])

Decorator factory for creating PDF filters with standardized processing.

RELEVANT_BLOCK

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.filter_page_if(condition: Callable[[Element], bool]) → Callable[[Callable[[Element], List[TextBlock]]], Callable[[Element], List[TextBlock]]]

Decorator factory for conditionally applying a PDF filter based on a predicate.

Creates a decorator that will only execute the wrapped PDF filter function if the specified condition evaluates to True for the given XML root element.

Parameters:

condition (Callable[[etree.Element], bool]) – A predicate function that determines whether the filter should be applied.

Returns:

A decorator that conditionally applies the PDF filter.

Return type:

Callable[[PdfFilterFunc], PdfFilterFunc]

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.standard_extraction_subfund(subfund_height: YRange, subfund_font: str) → Callable[[Callable[[Element], dict]], Callable[[Element], dict]]

Decorator for extracting subfund text and updating metadata.

Parameters:

  • subfund_height (YRange) – The vertical range in which the subfund text is expected.

  • subfund_font (str) – The font used by the subfund text.

Returns:

A decorator that updates metadata with the extracted subfund text.

Return type:

Callable[[UpdateMetadataFunc], UpdateMetadataFunc]

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.standard_pdf_filtering(header_txt: str, header_font: str, subfund_height: YRange, subfund_font: str, body_font: str, y_range: Tuple[float | Tuple[str, str] | None, float | Tuple[str, str] | None] | None = None, deselection_list: Tuple[str, str] | None = None, algorithm_flags: List = [False, False, False, False], tolerance: float = 0.0) → Callable[[Callable[[Element], List[TextBlock]]], Callable[[Element], List[TextBlock]]]

Decorator factory for creating PDF filters with standardized processing.

Creates a filter that: 1. Processes pages containing the specified header text in the specified header font. 2. Extracts lines with the specified body font as relevant blocks. 3. Extracts subfund text within a specified range or height. 4. Allows customization of page metadata and block types.

Parameters:

  • header_txt (str) – The text that must be present in the header to process the page.

  • header_font (Font) – The font used by the header text.

  • subfund_height (YRange) – The vertical range or height for subfund extraction.

  • subfund_font (Font) – The font used by the subfund text.

  • body_font (str) – The font used by the body text to extract as relevant blocks.

  • y_range (Optional[Tuple[Optional[float | Tuple[str, str]], Optional[float | Tuple[str, str]]]) – The vertical range for filtering lines, by default None.

  • deselection_list (Optional[Tuple[str, Font]], optional) – A list of text and font pairs to exclude from extraction, by default None.

Returns:

A decorator that applies the standardized PDF filter.

Return type:

Callable[[PdfFilterFunc], PdfFilterFunc]
